posts.html:
Unlike posts, pages in Ghost don't appear the main feed. They're separate, individual pages which only show up when you link to them. Great for content which is important, but separate from your usual posts.

An about page is a great example of one you might want to set up early on so people can find out more about you, and what you do. Why should people subscribe to your site and become a member? Details help!

Tip: If you're reading any post or page on your site and you notice something you want to edit, you can add /edit to the end of the URL – and you'll be taken directly to the Ghost editor.

Now tell the world what your site is all about.
posts.plaintext:
Unlike posts, pages in Ghost don't appear the main feed. They're separate,
individual pages which only show up when you link to them. Great for content
which is important, but separate from your usual posts.

An about page is a great example of one you might want to set up early on so
people can find out more about you, and what you do. Why should people subscribe
to your site and become a member? Details help!

> Tip: If you're reading any post or page on your site and you notice something
you want to edit, you can add /edit to the end of the URL – and you'll be taken
directly to the Ghost editor.
Now tell the world what your site is all about.

posts.html:
If you want to set up a contact page for people to be able to reach out to you, the simplest way is to set up a simple page like this and list the different ways people can reach out to you.

For example, here's how to reach us!

  • @Ghost on Twitter
  • @Ghost on Facebook
  • @Ghost on Instagram

If you prefer to use a contact form, almost all of the great embedded form services work great with Ghost and are easy to set up:
posts.plaintext:
If you want to set up a contact page for people to be able to reach out to you,
the simplest way is to set up a simple page like this and list the different
ways people can reach out to you.

For example, here's how to reach us!
 * @Ghost [https://twitter.com/ghost] on Twitter
 * @Ghost [https://www.facebook.com/ghost] on Facebook
 * @Ghost [https://instagram.com/ghost] on Instagram

If you prefer to use a contact form, almost all of the great embedded form
services work great with Ghost and are easy to set up:

[https://ghost.org/integrations/?tag=forms]

posts.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Wondering how Ghost fares when it comes to privacy and GDPR rules? Good news: Ghost does not use any tracking cookies of any kind."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"You can integrate any products, services, ads or integrations with Ghost yourself if you want to, but it's always a good idea to disclose how subscriber data will be used by putting together a privacy page."]]]],"ghostVersion":"4.0"}
posts.html:
Wondering how Ghost fares when it comes to privacy and GDPR rules? Good news: Ghost does not use any tracking cookies of any kind.

You can integrate any products, services, ads or integrations with Ghost yourself if you want to, but it's always a good idea to disclose how subscriber data will be used by putting together a privacy page.
posts.plaintext:
Wondering how Ghost fares when it comes to privacy and GDPR rules? Good news:
Ghost does not use any tracking cookies of any kind.

You can integrate any products, services, ads or integrations with Ghost
yourself if you want to, but it's always a good idea to disclose how subscriber
data will be used by putting together a privacy page.

Oh hey, you clicked every link of our starter content and even clicked this small link in the footer! If you like Ghost and you're enjoying the product so far, we'd hugely appreciate your support in any way you care to show it.

Ghost is a non-profit organization, and we give away all our intellectual property as open source software. If you believe in what we do, there are a number of ways you can give us a hand, and we hugely appreciate all of them:

  • Contribute code via GitHub
  • Contribute financially via GitHub Sponsors
  • Contribute financially via Open Collective
  • Contribute reviews via writing a blog post
  • Contribute good vibes via telling your friends about us

Thanks for checking us out!

posts.html:
blueish grey eyes
set deeply upon
the pallid arch
of each cheek

framed by hair
the color of night
reflecting naught
of this moonset glow

delirium touched mind
and an equally dark heart
my soul is stirred by this
most debased amalgam

forgive me
my forsaken sensibility
for I could never be
more in love

a.e

posts.html:
closing this final chapter
of romantic prose
i pause before extinguishing the light
to gaze upon you while peacefully asleep
and relent once more to wicked imaginings
abandoning our vows
if only for the slightest moment
and dare to conjure
some pale simulacrum
of a chained Andromeda
or caged Rapunzel
to shape you as my imperiled maiden
and ideal archetype of ancient melodrama
though as you stir and wake
i reluctantly concede that
despite my reckless thoughts
i cannot fancy you skulking haplessly
amidst these tattered verses
for you are no ordinary
damsel in distress

a.e

posts.html:
i smile through the tears
and imagine you are both
best of friends now
in the life after this

loving mother laughing sweetly
at the half-hearted attempt
to capture an agile
and cleverly mocking bird

adored pet weaving an ebony form
among the stalks of corn
and peas in their pods
growing against the back wall

both in comforted peace
waiting to rejoin their loved ones
in the garden they share
and have been patiently tending

a.e

Waiting for you
Is effortless
When each thought
Is a sweet daydream

As you approach
I lift my eyes
From the last page
And delight
In the dissymmetry of
Your mischievous smile

posts.html:
Oh, my sweet and most pure Queen!
My heart is awash in the splendor of the dawn,
for you have called me your King!

I am sustained by these thoughts of you,
of endless, requited love across a distance.
The wind carries the sweet lullaby of your voice,
my beautiful, radiant songbird of the Rabat-Sale.

I call out to the sun and moon and stars
to keep watch over you when my eyes dare to stray.
I pray for the gods both old and new, obscured and forgotten,
to join our wandering souls in the realm of dreams.

Let us journey forth, hands locked in sweet embrace,
bound by an inevitable and most divine consummation.
Grant me the gift of your royalty, oh my dearest Soul,
my rarest blossom in the Valley of the Roses.

Let me be your earth, let my joyful tears be the rain
that falls upon the softly rolling hills of your form.
Let me reap the infinite bounty of your sweet fruit
as I am ravenous for the nourishment of your lips.

Oh, my sweet and most pure Queen!
Let my ecstasy be the morning dew
that kisses your petals before each new dawn.

a.e

posts.title: THE STAR SPAWN
posts.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"As I lay here with my dearest Cassia, now fast asleep upon my chest, my thoughts drift across an ocean of desperation. It has been forty days since the entrance to the vault was sealed shut behind us, and the failure of these last rounds of experiments have me quietly unnerved."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Cassia, ever the optimist, yet believes that some iteration of our approach will reveal a successful divination. Indeed, I am heartened to see that she has shown little sign of her previous squeamishness and assists me in even the most macabre of rituals without wilting. For this, I should be thankful, yet more often of late my narrow and judging eyes have betrayed my growing irascibility at her presence."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Now, when she suggests a variation upon our latest failed cantrip, I am quick to wound her with an exacting and arbitrary deconstruction of her analysis. Monster that I am, the flash of hurt across her face at my stiff rebuke pains me much less than each additional miscarriage of these damnable incantations."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"If I were a more amiable companion, I would encourage whatever naive hope she continues to offer me. I would praise each alteration in the measure and beat of her words and proffer a more tender acceptance of her contribution instead of pure and creeping resentment. Now, I cannot help but silently lament as I descry her every barren invocation. Each attempt is more futile than the last, wearisome beyond even my tolerance, slowly and unfairly eroding the warmth I once felt for her stewardship."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Even our nightly lovemaking has become a slow rhythmic pattern of uninspired labor."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"By some blessing, Cassia appears largely unburdened by the mounting failures and still looks to me for steadfast guidance and faithfulness. She must have trust in both my duty and capability. As such, I will muster the endurance for one final day of this false devotional bravado.  Still, I worry outwardly for her sanity. Even the most resolute mind is eventually withered to the point of madness by the sheer number of dark oaths and vile declarations that must be sworn equally from spirit and tongue. Yet, I have managed to remain relatively immune, though troubled cogitation threatens to corrupt the limits of my reasoning."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"This undoubtedly ignoble endeavor is evermore a casualty of my suffering memory, its true purpose lost within a listless and wandering haze, moving ever closer to the periphery of my subconscious. These journal entries have served intent well enough, and recent mornings have found me searching each tattered page and hasty scrawl of calligraphy for some semblance of reality upon which to moor the remnants of my sanity."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Inescapably, I am becoming acutely aware of a familiar emotion welling up inside me; a silent and cruel indifference toward my loyal and gentle Cassia. I have kept two secrets from her. First, that she has not been my first consort within these walls.  Second, that the innocent blood under her pale and delightful skin has been the only ingredient needed for this undertaking."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Were I capable of finding virtue in love or merit in the single-mindedness of her blind obedience, I would be tempted to allay her fears and ask for some modicum of forgiveness, however, I have a duty to the purity of the blood. Only in the fleeting moment of her final, distressed recognition would the blood achieve its fantastic potential, and to corrupt it beforehand would only delay the expected."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Cassia stirs within my embrace and for an instant I fear that my thoughts were put to voice, but no. It must be near midnight now, and a peaceful, knowing stillness has befallen our bedchamber like a funeral veil. I lean forward and softly kiss her forehead and run my fingers through the dark auburn coils of her hair. Though no authentic act of kindness, I make a silent plea in hopes that she is not wholly consumed by the forthcoming consecration."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"There is no answer but the gentle sigh and soft warmth of her breath."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Sleep sweetly, my dearest Cassia."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"a.e"]]]],"ghostVersion":"3.0"}
posts.html:
As I lay here with my dearest Cassia, now fast asleep upon my chest, my thoughts drift across an ocean of desperation. It has been forty days since the entrance to the vault was sealed shut behind us, and the failure of these last rounds of experiments have me quietly unnerved.

Cassia, ever the optimist, yet believes that some iteration of our approach will reveal a successful divination. Indeed, I am heartened to see that she has shown little sign of her previous squeamishness and assists me in even the most macabre of rituals without wilting. For this, I should be thankful, yet more often of late my narrow and judging eyes have betrayed my growing irascibility at her presence.

Now, when she suggests a variation upon our latest failed cantrip, I am quick to wound her with an exacting and arbitrary deconstruction of her analysis. Monster that I am, the flash of hurt across her face at my stiff rebuke pains me much less than each additional miscarriage of these damnable incantations.

If I were a more amiable companion, I would encourage whatever naive hope she continues to offer me. I would praise each alteration in the measure and beat of her words and proffer a more tender acceptance of her contribution instead of pure and creeping resentment. Now, I cannot help but silently lament as I descry her every barren invocation. Each attempt is more futile than the last, wearisome beyond even my tolerance, slowly and unfairly eroding the warmth I once felt for her stewardship.

Even our nightly lovemaking has become a slow rhythmic pattern of uninspired labor.

By some blessing, Cassia appears largely unburdened by the mounting failures and still looks to me for steadfast guidance and faithfulness. She must have trust in both my duty and capability. As such, I will muster the endurance for one final day of this false devotional bravado.  Still, I worry outwardly for her sanity. Even the most resolute mind is eventually withered to the point of madness by the sheer number of dark oaths and vile declarations that must be sworn equally from spirit and tongue. Yet, I have managed to remain relatively immune, though troubled cogitation threatens to corrupt the limits of my reasoning.

This undoubtedly ignoble endeavor is evermore a casualty of my suffering memory, its true purpose lost within a listless and wandering haze, moving ever closer to the periphery of my subconscious. These journal entries have served intent well enough, and recent mornings have found me searching each tattered page and hasty scrawl of calligraphy for some semblance of reality upon which to moor the remnants of my sanity.

Inescapably, I am becoming acutely aware of a familiar emotion welling up inside me; a silent and cruel indifference toward my loyal and gentle Cassia. I have kept two secrets from her. First, that she has not been my first consort within these walls.  Second, that the innocent blood under her pale and delightful skin has been the only ingredient needed for this undertaking.

Were I capable of finding virtue in love or merit in the single-mindedness of her blind obedience, I would be tempted to allay her fears and ask for some modicum of forgiveness, however, I have a duty to the purity of the blood. Only in the fleeting moment of her final, distressed recognition would the blood achieve its fantastic potential, and to corrupt it beforehand would only delay the expected.

Cassia stirs within my embrace and for an instant I fear that my thoughts were put to voice, but no. It must be near midnight now, and a peaceful, knowing stillness has befallen our bedchamber like a funeral veil. I lean forward and softly kiss her forehead and run my fingers through the dark auburn coils of her hair. Though no authentic act of kindness, I make a silent plea in hopes that she is not wholly consumed by the forthcoming consecration.

There is no answer but the gentle sigh and soft warmth of her breath.

Sleep sweetly, my dearest Cassia.

a.e

posts.html:
You spoke the words:  "Kiria-Suun-Amun"

Watching the delicate syllables depart from your lips,
I fell into rhythm with each tumbling curve.
Sweet ambrosia crashed against my yearning eardrums,
as your tongue was a sway of treble and tremor

In desperation, I upended the hourglass of my memory
even as the last whisper escaped your sweet mouth
to live eternal the gift of your revelation
as at last you grant me the courtesy of your name.

a.e

posts.html:
YOU: In front of me at the grocery checkout line at 12:39pm.  Approximately 5’7, long straight dark hair, green eyes, glasses slightly too large for your face (I reserved judgment).  Plaid button up with cashmere pullover, black crescent moon choker, five ox leather bracelets with undetermined tribal pattern on your left wrist, two of brushed silver adorned your right, each with turquoise brick inlay - I failed to decipher the etched inscription.  Brown pencil skirt neatly paired with black leggings, canvas high tops with some sort of occult inspired print - your scent was a mix of lavender and public school library. Grocery total came to $12.77 and included your donation to Feeding America.

ME: 5’11 and ¾.  Dark, curly hair in need of a trim, “Han Shot First” tri-blend tee with gray undershirt, nondescript black overcoat, jeans with a tear flaunting my right kneecap (you noticed).  I have not worn a watch since high school. Items on the conveyor as follows: a single Granny Smith apple, bagged. Caramel treats, a peanut butter protein bar, vegetable bouillon and small bag of extra long grain enriched rice. I did not keep the receipt.

WE: Both purchased a 16 oz bottle of Synergy, your flavor was “Tantric Turmeric” and mine was “Heart Beet”.  While we agreed on the uncertain etymology of kombucha, we butted heads regarding the more therapeutically effective bacterial component.  The bagger gave merit to both arguments, though I ultimately acquiesced, deferring to your superior knowledge of stirred reactors and symbiotic cultures.  Neither of us wanted to make a lusty ruckus at this particular Whole Foods.

I’m sorry I declined the immediate invitation to meet your demon of a mother. Shall we meet again to discuss whether Spanish rain actually stays mainly in the plain?

posts.html:
Bellastasia Fawn narrowed her eyes against the clinical glare of the overhanging lamp, slowly releasing the breath that she had taken in almost a minute earlier. She attempted to raise a hand in front of her face but to no avail. Her neurons gave commands that her muscles would not obey, regardless of her willpower. She feigned another attempt, if only to fool herself into believing she wanted to struggle against the invisible bonds. She knew, as before, that movement was a luxury granted to her only if she was compliant. Thankfully, blind obedience had never been her strength.

Her pale skin felt bare against the odd, metallic-plastic alloy that comprised the familiar, rectangular platform she lay upon. Her modesty was only just spared by the paper-thin wisp of linen that concealed just enough to prevent her from blushing. She had long stopped questioning why THEY didn't just allow her to remain in whatever fashion of nightgown she had worn to bed. Was it some form of control? Did THEY realize that by now the control was unnecessary? It shamed her to admit it. This shame and control was just more confirmation that she had once again been TAKEN. She sighed defiantly - full in the knowledge that she was once again back aboard THE CRAFT.

The lamp dimmed, and on cue, as each time before, she felt the presence of THEM - always in their group of three, always positioned at her head, feet and side. As her eyesight began to adjust, she recognized the one poised directly above her - she had referred to him as Mr. Alien Grey. His lidless eyes had always seemed to hold a modicum of false compassion and authority absent in his companions. Had he ever spoken, she imagined that he would have given her words of comfort and veiled commandment as his stewards performed their assigned set of EXPERIMENTS.

Instead, staring into the perfect blackness of his oval eyes, she felt the familiar sensation of his universal sentience as it descended and permeated her mind, assuring her that she was SPECIAL – that she was reserved for an otherworldly purpose he was not willing to disclose. Never had the experiments been physically invasive. The companions had always moved their frail, colorless hands above the length of her body, pausing periodically above her abdomen. She knew instinctively, as a woman, that they were trying once more to gift her womb with some hybrid abomination.

After a time, Mr. Alien Grey tilted his head ever so slightly and motioned for the companions to discontinue their methodical attempts, no doubt frustrated at the repeated inability to seed her. Bellastasia took a small victory in this, as she had the times before. She steadily projected her ardent refusal at becoming implanted if she remained an unwilling conscript. She would have answers first, all the answers.

Mr. Alien Grey placed his thin hands upon each side of her head, the only contact she had ever been granted by the visitors. Her skin tingled and itched as his fingers traced over her temples in a practiced pattern that always preceded a benign coma. She stared into his eyes with her remaining awareness and projected images of defiance before finally managing a wry grin as each wave of unconscious bliss began to pull her further from the celestial shore of any known reality.

Soon she would awaken in her own bed, more steadfast in her resistance and resolute in her desire to doom the intruders.

a.e

posts.title: LOVE IS A MOTHERBOARD
posts.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"A massive firewall blocked our further progress, but beyond I saw her - my incomparable Princess, and with her were Nvidia and AM-Dee. Already the server chamber had begun to turn but a portion of the opening in the firewall allowed me to once more set eyes upon my future Queen. Slowly the port was closing. In a short time there would be but a tiny crack, and then even that would be closed, and for another LifeCycle the chamber would slowly revolve until once more for a brief day the aperture in its firewall would allow access from the corridor’s end. At the end of which my companion and I now stood."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"But in the meantime what horrible things would go on within that chamber!"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"When she saw me she rushed towards the magnetically bound bars that separated us."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"“Compu-Tor!” I cried to my faithful companion. “Can no power stop this awful revolving thing? Is there none who holds the secret of these terrible bars?”"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"My companion looked dismayed. “None, I fear, whom we could fetch in time, though I shall go and make the attempt. Wait for me here.”"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"After he had left I stood and talked with my sweet Holly Daytah, and she stretched her dear hand through those cruel bars that I might hold it until the last moment."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Nvidia and AM-Dee came close also, but when Nvidia saw that we would be alone she withdrew to the further side of the chamber. Not so the daughter of Arch-Rival."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"“Antonius of IT,” she said, “this be the last time that you shall see any of us. Tell me that you love me, that I may die happy.”"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"“I love only the Princess of Daytah,” I replied quietly. “I’m sorry, AM-Dee, but it is as I have told you from the beginning.”"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"She bit her lip and turned away, but not before I saw the black and ugly scowl she turned upon Holly Daytah. Thereafter she stood a little way apart, but not so far as I should have desired, for I had many little confidences to impart to my long-lost love."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"For a few minutes we stood thus talking in low tones. Ever smaller and smaller grew the opening. In a short time now it would be too small even to permit the slender form of my Princess to pass. Oh, why did not Compu-Tor haste? Above we could hear the faint echoes of a great tumult. It was the multitude of antivirus fighting their way through the fire from the burning Temple of Core."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"A draft from above brought the fumes of smoke to our nostrils. As we stood waiting for Compu-Tor the smoke became thicker and thicker. Presently we heard shouting at the far end of the corridor, and hurrying feet."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"\"Come back, Antonius, come back!\" cried a voice, \"even the servers have caught fire.\""]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"In a moment a dozen men broke through the now blinding smoke to my side. There was Ay-Vgee, and PolyCom, and Enterprise-IO, and Compu-Tor, with a few more who had just earlier followed me to the temple courtyard."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"\"There is no hope, Antonius,\" cried Compu-Tor. \"The keeper of the SSL keys is dead and his keys are not upon his carcass. Our only hope is to quench this conflagration and trust to fate that a LifeCycle from now will find your Princess alive and well. I have brought sufficient PowerBars to last them. When this port closes no smoke can reach them, and if we hasten to extinguish the flames I believe they will be safe.\""]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"\"Go, then, yourself and take these others with you,\" I replied. \"I shall remain here beside my Princess until a merciful death releases me from my anguish. I care not to live.\""]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"As I spoke Compu-Tor had been tossing a great number of tiny cans within the chamber cell. The remaining crack was not over an inch in width a moment later. Holly Daytah stood as close to it as she could, whispering words of hope and courage to me, and urging me to save myself."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Suddenly beyond her I saw the beautiful face of Nvidia contorted into an expression of malign hatred. As my eyes met hers she spoke."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"\"Think not, Antonius, that you may so lightly cast aside the love of Nvidia, daughter of Arch-Rival. Nor ever hope to hold thy Holly Daytah in thy arms again. Wait you the long, long LifeCycle; but know that when the waiting is over it shall be Nvidia’s arms which shall welcome you - not those of the Princess of Daytah. Behold, she dies!\""]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"And as she finished speaking I saw her raise an encrypted dagger on high, and then I saw another figure. It was AM-Dee’s. As the dagger fell toward the unprotected breast of my love, AM-Dee was almost between them. A blinding gust of smoke blotted out the tragedy within that fearsome chamber - a shriek rang out, a single shriek, as the dagger fell."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The smoke cleared away, but we stood gazing upon a blank wall. The last port had closed, and for a LifeCycle that hideous chamber would retain its secret from the eyes of techie men."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"My companions urged me to leave."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"\"In a moment it will be too late,\" cried Compu-Tor. \"There is, in fact, but a bare chance that we can come through to the outer network alive even now. I have ordered the pumps started, and in five minutes the pits will be flooded. If we would not drown like rats in a trap we must hasten above and make a dash for safety through the burning temple.\""]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"\"Go,\" I urged them. \"Let me die here beside my Princess - there is no hope or happiness elsewhere for me. When they carry her dear body from that terrible place a year hence let them find the body of her prince awaiting her.\""]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Of what happened after that I have only a confused recollection. It seems as though I struggled with many men, and then that I was picked bodily from the ground and borne away. I do not know. I have never asked, nor has any other who was there that day intruded on my sorrow or recalled to my mind the occurrences which they know could but at best reopen the terrible wound within my heart."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Ah! If I could but know one thing, what a burden of suspense would be lifted from my shoulders! But whether the assassin's encrypted dagger reached one fair bosom or another, only time will divulge…"]]]],"ghostVersion":"3.0"}
posts.html:
A massive firewall blocked our further progress, but beyond I saw her - my incomparable Princess, and with her were Nvidia and AM-Dee. Already the server chamber had begun to turn but a portion of the opening in the firewall allowed me to once more set eyes upon my future Queen. Slowly the port was closing. In a short time there would be but a tiny crack, and then even that would be closed, and for another LifeCycle the chamber would slowly revolve until once more for a brief day the aperture in its firewall would allow access from the corridor’s end. At the end of which my companion and I now stood.

But in the meantime what horrible things would go on within that chamber!

When she saw me she rushed towards the magnetically bound bars that separated us.

“Compu-Tor!” I cried to my faithful companion. “Can no power stop this awful revolving thing? Is there none who holds the secret of these terrible bars?”

My companion looked dismayed. “None, I fear, whom we could fetch in time, though I shall go and make the attempt. Wait for me here.”

After he had left I stood and talked with my sweet Holly Daytah, and she stretched her dear hand through those cruel bars that I might hold it until the last moment.

Nvidia and AM-Dee came close also, but when Nvidia saw that we would be alone she withdrew to the further side of the chamber. Not so the daughter of Arch-Rival.

“Antonius of IT,” she said, “this be the last time that you shall see any of us. Tell me that you love me, that I may die happy.”

“I love only the Princess of Daytah,” I replied quietly. “I’m sorry, AM-Dee, but it is as I have told you from the beginning.”

She bit her lip and turned away, but not before I saw the black and ugly scowl she turned upon Holly Daytah. Thereafter she stood a little way apart, but not so far as I should have desired, for I had many little confidences to impart to my long-lost love.

For a few minutes we stood thus talking in low tones. Ever smaller and smaller grew the opening. In a short time now it would be too small even to permit the slender form of my Princess to pass. Oh, why did not Compu-Tor haste? Above we could hear the faint echoes of a great tumult. It was the multitude of antivirus fighting their way through the fire from the burning Temple of Core.

A draft from above brought the fumes of smoke to our nostrils. As we stood waiting for Compu-Tor the smoke became thicker and thicker. Presently we heard shouting at the far end of the corridor, and hurrying feet.

"Come back, Antonius, come back!" cried a voice, "even the servers have caught fire."

In a moment a dozen men broke through the now blinding smoke to my side. There was Ay-Vgee, and PolyCom, and Enterprise-IO, and Compu-Tor, with a few more who had just earlier followed me to the temple courtyard.

"There is no hope, Antonius," cried Compu-Tor. "The keeper of the SSL keys is dead and his keys are not upon his carcass. Our only hope is to quench this conflagration and trust to fate that a LifeCycle from now will find your Princess alive and well. I have brought sufficient PowerBars to last them. When this port closes no smoke can reach them, and if we hasten to extinguish the flames I believe they will be safe."

"Go, then, yourself and take these others with you," I replied. "I shall remain here beside my Princess until a merciful death releases me from my anguish. I care not to live."

As I spoke Compu-Tor had been tossing a great number of tiny cans within the chamber cell. The remaining crack was not over an inch in width a moment later. Holly Daytah stood as close to it as she could, whispering words of hope and courage to me, and urging me to save myself.

Suddenly beyond her I saw the beautiful face of Nvidia contorted into an expression of malign hatred. As my eyes met hers she spoke.

"Think not, Antonius, that you may so lightly cast aside the love of Nvidia, daughter of Arch-Rival. Nor ever hope to hold thy Holly Daytah in thy arms again. Wait you the long, long LifeCycle; but know that when the waiting is over it shall be Nvidia’s arms which shall welcome you - not those of the Princess of Daytah. Behold, she dies!"

And as she finished speaking I saw her raise an encrypted dagger on high, and then I saw another figure. It was AM-Dee’s. As the dagger fell toward the unprotected breast of my love, AM-Dee was almost between them. A blinding gust of smoke blotted out the tragedy within that fearsome chamber - a shriek rang out, a single shriek, as the dagger fell.

The smoke cleared away, but we stood gazing upon a blank wall. The last port had closed, and for a LifeCycle that hideous chamber would retain its secret from the eyes of techie men.

My companions urged me to leave.

"In a moment it will be too late," cried Compu-Tor. "There is, in fact, but a bare chance that we can come through to the outer network alive even now. I have ordered the pumps started, and in five minutes the pits will be flooded. If we would not drown like rats in a trap we must hasten above and make a dash for safety through the burning temple."

"Go," I urged them. "Let me die here beside my Princess - there is no hope or happiness elsewhere for me. When they carry her dear body from that terrible place a year hence let them find the body of her prince awaiting her."

Of what happened after that I have only a confused recollection. It seems as though I struggled with many men, and then that I was picked bodily from the ground and borne away. I do not know. I have never asked, nor has any other who was there that day intruded on my sorrow or recalled to my mind the occurrences which they know could but at best reopen the terrible wound within my heart.

Ah! If I could but know one thing, what a burden of suspense would be lifted from my shoulders! But whether the assassin's encrypted dagger reached one fair bosom or another, only time will divulge…

posts.html:
So my gym crush and I have the best unspoken relationship rules:

Allowed:
Awkward, not-so-random sustained eye contact.
Using each other's presence to fuel our workouts.

Forbidden:
Making actual conversation.
Making actual conversation with any other gym member of the opposite sex.
Having a backup gym crush.
Speaking to other gym members about US and what WE have.

Currently Awaiting Approval:
Using any combination of Google or public record search, cross referenced social media platform database discovery or reverse image search to learn more about each other because, after all, these types of relationships are built and grown on a foundation of mutual admiration and trust.

Aren't we the greatest?!

posts.html:
"Why are you such an ass hat?"

I let the night air soak into my skin while considering her words.

Technically, she wasn't wrong.

Just because I was being an asshat didn't mean I couldn't try and convince her otherwise.

"Look, I..."

"STOP."

"I'm trying to explain..."

"STOP!"

"What the heck, Leah?  What do you even want from me then?" I feigned exasperation.

"I want you to reexamine your priorities.  I'm only in this stupid party because you asked me to be here and you PROMISED you'd help me level up.  Now all you do is act jealous whenever some random internet guy helps me by dropping gear or running rifts when you aren't around."

"Oh please, like some pervert from the internet is going to make me jealous."

She cocked her head to one side and snapped her fingers at me.  "Oh, you're freaking jealous.  He is 500 Paragon higher than you AND has a fully matched gear set.  You...you barely know how to craft a decent sized gem!"

"Typical freaking gamer chick, kicking a man right in the gemstones," was my lame response.

"Look," she continued, "if you want to keep playing together then you need to care less about my levels and more about being supportive and patient while I figure everything out."

"Leah, give me a break.  This is just what WE DO.  I act like a complete jerk and you pretend not to enjoy it.  Rinse and repeat."

Another finger snap.  "Does the look on my face tell you I enjoy any part of this!?  You delusional moron.  Now I know exactly why Adria warned me about playing with you.  And to think, you had me convinced that she was the crazy one."

That stung.  "Don't you dare bring her up.  Don't even say her name.  How dare you bring her into this."

"Typical Antonius.  Avoiding any and all analysis of your failed relationships."

Again, technically, she wasn't wrong.

This is why I hate MMORPGs.

posts.html:
Dr. Clifford Anton has resigned himself to a death on the Red Planet.

The promise of being the first to discover the artifacts on Mars.

six months and 35 million miles.

The dust storm drove Dr. Clifford Anton deep beneath the rust red alluvium of Arsia Mons; far into the twisted maze of the Martian catacombs formed by the dying breath of the last gasp of the planet

as Mars expelled its last breath into the black cold of space.

Lost within maze of the Martian catacombs

In the pursuit of immortality and eternal fame in the annals of archaeology, Dr. Anton has unwittingly sentenced himself to death on THE RED PLANET.

Far beneath the rust red alluvium of Arsia Mons

The promise of making the single greatest discovery in the history of xenoarcheology.  Finding evidence of a lost civilization on Mars.

Footsteps in the dust.  Imprints in the sand leading further into the cold blackness of the tunnel

mprints of in the otherwise undisturbed underworld of Mars.

Finding the imprint of a Martian footprint in the undisturbed dusted underworld of the Martian catacombs.

discovery of some ancient Martian reliquary

but what lay before him shattered even the wildest of expectations.


Dr. Clifford Anton has resigned himself to a death on the Red Planet.   and with him the hidden history secrets secrets remain unclaimed for yet another untold millennia.

Unless...

posts.html:
standing in the doorway while watching your shadow emerge
from among the flakes of diffuse white and amber incandescence
frozen specks peppering your fresh face and dark tresses
with fallen stars dancing upon the winter wind
to the steady beat and willful purpose of your footsteps

closing my eyes in the moment you leap into my arms
and we stumble across the threshold
in frantic and unfamiliar embrace
your scent is of cinnamon and honey and sage
your soft and chilled lips brush my cheek
stirring my blood and rousing my senses

your warm and breathless whisper next to my ear
grants me permission and resolute confidence
to unlock every promise of my unrealized potential

you are the first love
of my new year

posts.html:
my soul acts as a persuasive
and tender intermediary
between this wounded heart
and shattered self-consciousness

when anxious words
and spurious deeds fail
to erase the doubtful
stare of your eyes

it offers a cautious revelation
both apprehensive and valiant
equally seeking an authentic alterity
and dissolution of ego

for this new connection
and awareness
is more complicated than you think
for me

a.e

posts.html:
dark empress of sweet abomination
despite your explicit
and overtly false promises
i grant you my complete surrender
while offering dark benediction
and blind devotion
to a black and hollow crown
adorned with false chastity

oh my unrelenting succubus
luring me into a love most malign
i have damned my soul
and bartered my immortality
for a moment with your cursed lips
upon which I must
quench my foolhardy lust

a.e

posts.title: PALE ENCHANTRESS
posts.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"pale enchantress"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"jewel of the seven stars"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"come forth to me"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"sweet entity of the dark"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"you are radiant against"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"this black canvas of night"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"the starlight against"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"your pale flesh"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"is the reckless expression"],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"of a celestial"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"and wanton catharsis"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"your voice is the winter wind"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"an incantation of impure desire"],[1,[],0,9],[0,[],0,"to which I relent absolutely"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"my heart is yours again"],[1,[],0,10],[0,[],0,"as am I once more"],[1,[],0,11],[0,[],0,"your eternal possession"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"and leave behind all"],[1,[],0,12],[0,[],0,"longing for New Gilead"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"a.e"]]]],"ghostVersion":"3.0"}
posts.html:
pale enchantress
jewel of the seven stars
come forth to me

sweet entity of the dark
you are radiant against
this black canvas of night

the starlight against
your pale flesh
is the reckless expression
of a celestial
and wanton catharsis

your voice is the winter wind
an incantation of impure desire
to which I relent absolutely

my heart is yours again
as am I once more
your eternal possession

and leave behind all
longing for New Gilead

a.e

As she descends upon me, the rapture of her approaching gift pushes aside the brief moment of sheer terror.

The web vibrates in distinct and unholy resonance, awakening me from a venom induced stupor.    As she descends upon me, the rapture of her approaching gift pushes aside the brief moment of sheer terror.

I fight the blackness as she gorges on

long enough to enjoy every moment of

out lips me and a hear a sound - a fusion of dripping raindrops and a fresh, murmuring breeze.  Fresh fly in the web.  Caught this morning.  I am truly alive.  She wants only me.  It's an honor.

this will be a time of great concentration and momentum.

there will be a need for you to cast aside your previous dispositions and feelings and warnings and lifestyle.

you are moving into a space of comfort and healing and knowledge and support. you have been given the chance to heal your heart and your spirit and to allow strength and growth and healing to take hold.  

you must not take or find anger in the pursuits of your loved ones.

you must be supportive and adaptive to their interests and their words.

take heed, this life is not about you or for you.

you have traded your future and soul for material instincts.

you must recapture control of your spirit

this will be a time of great concentration and momentum.

there will be a need for you to cast aside your previous dispositions and
feelings and warnings and lifestyle. 

you are moving into a space of comfort and healing and knowledge and support.
you have been given the chance to heal your heart and your spirit and to allow
strength and growth and healing to take hold.

you must not take or find anger in the pursuits of your loved ones.

you must be supportive and adaptive to their interests and their words.

take heed, this life is not about you or for you.

posts.title: BURN THE ENEMIES
posts.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Oh my Queen, how I long to gaze upon your reflection in the lake of fire that I will burn your enemies within.  I want naught for myself – save only to hear the howls of your ecstasy crack across the highest peaks and lowest canyons of your domain - to feel your breath on my neck as you demand obedience - to have your heels press into my back as each beat of my wings lays bare each fold and crease of The Known World.  Let me show you to your Iron Throne!  Only this would I ask the gods to provide - not from selfish want, but dutiful need.  Let my claws rend the flesh of nonbelievers and drip with the blood of your rightful vengeance!  Mount me and conquer!  Ride Khaleesi!  By the gods, ride me with the ardent fury of your deepest desire!"]]]],"ghostVersion":"3.0"}

howls of your ecstasy crack across the highest peaks and lowest canyons of your
domain - to feel your breath on my neck as you demand obedience - to have your
heels press into my back as each beat of my wings lays bare each fold and crease
of The Known World.  Let me show you to your Iron Throne!  Only this would I ask
the gods to provide - not from selfish want, but dutiful need.  Let my claws
rend the flesh of nonbelievers and drip with the blood of your rightful
vengeance!  Mount me and conquer!  Ride Khaleesi!  By the gods, ride me with the
ardent fury of your deepest desire!

posts.html:
[From the Accounts of Lady Kappo]

Lo! How the gods of the Trial Balance once again mock me!

To grant me this sliver of light and coax a plea from the remnants of my sanity. I know that none but the End of Month Moon would be so brazen to illuminate whatever catacomb abyss the Shadow Accountants have sought to conceal me within. Would that I could once more set eyes upon the Great Plains above – the land of my ancestors, home of my kin - whose voices have long since faded against the maniacal howling of General Ledger as he urges his Czech Machine to rend through soil and flesh. Not even these walls of black earth and cold stone can mute the horror from assaulting my ears.

And yet here, caged, the last of my faith lies with you.

I implore you, Lady Célene Kappo,

born of the House of Gaap,

bearer of the Fair Countenance,

wielder of the Amórtize Blade,

slayer of the last Red Ink God,

hear my appeal for justice!

Whether by sword or flame or illusion or transmutation, I will not judge the manner and design of your retribution!

For as we know,

the books demand balance.

[From the Accounts of Lady Kappo]

The last fortnight of each Fyscal Year is witness to an astronomical wonder as yet unexplained by patrons of science or magic. The sun, whether directed by forces cosmic or by the gods of the mystics, begins to trace a lazy arc across the sky, never once falling below the horizon nor completely rising to its zenith. Below, in the villages and estates of the south, there is cause for joy as the last yield of crops are gathered and their sums weighed and measured against years prior. While most revel in the promise of a bountiful harvest, the more cunning look to a diminished return and lessened duty to the Cold Well Levy - a fund long imposed to fill the coffers of the Kings and Queens of the White Collar. And yet, despite such burden, these final days of Near Winter are a time of celebration and mirth.

Not so in the vast expanse of the northern Great Plains, home to the frozen Relevant Range.

Under the warmth of the suns constant vigil, the snow and ice begins to thaw from the multitude of crags and peaks that form this black and desolate sierra, slowly exposing the most sinister among them - the Salārie Spire. A narrow and near impassable pathway also becomes visible, a serpentine pattern in its ascent. Whether carved by nature or man, none can say with any certainty. Fewer still make claim to having conquered the spire and among them none would dare speak of what lies at the top.

But where the tales of adventurers end, the books of legend and lore show no such fear. They speak of the final resting place of Aabacus, High Priest of the Actuaries and Warden of the Petty Cache. Whispers of immeasurable treasures and the monstrous creatures that guard them. And while the validity of its existence has depreciated over the ages, the cracked and faded pages reveal a common truth – that even the most iron forged of men – the most resolute of valor – the sternest of constitution - all pale when confronted with the rumored horrors within. And today, the books will speak true. No man will ever conquer the summit. And indeed, a woman now stands before the doorway to the Necropolis of the Bookkeeper.

Lady Célene Kappo has ascended the spire.

[From the Accounts of Lady Kappo]

The massive stones guarding the ancient death chamber parted only after Lady Kappo spoke the words she had been tasked to memorize at a much younger age. The Magister had freely imparted this knowledge to her with no sense of worry. For how could he truly expect one such as her to ever in any lifetime bear witness to the gateway. And yet here she stood.  Her eyes had strained into the dark, hoping for some shadow of movement to betray itself, hoping for some hint of the horrors within. The Amórtize blade had cut through countless foes, but none of them spectral, immaterial.  Could it pierce the heart of a spirit?

Lady Kappo relished the sound of metal against bone, deeply twisting blade into blood and sinew as man and beast alike wretched in their death knells.  She always met the fading eyes of her enemy as the last gasps of their lives escaped, borne upon the wind back to whatever nameless hell they had been birthed.  Yes, she believed in her blade. Trusted her blade.  Her knowledge of the spirit realm was much less, adept.

Quiet minutes passed before she dared to set forth into blackness. No sooner had she cleared the entrance when an almost imperceptible strand of web brushed against her forehead.  Her hand moved to her face just as the stone blocks began to collapse behind her, cracking as they hit the floor with an abrupt BOOM that echoed with vile and uncanny resonance throughout the indeterminable length of the abyss.  She stifled a scream and dropped to her stomach, whispering curses into the dust.  Her lack of foresight and inability to detect even the most rudimentary mechanism.

From her vantage point, the crypt appeared vacant below. If this was to be the final resting place of Aabacus, the High Priest, then it

The voice grated through her mind like a thousand mice scrambling through the underdark.

“Lady Kappo! WE. SEE. YOU!”

The massive stones guarding the ancient death chamber parted only after Lady Kappo spoke the words she had been tasked to memorize at a much younger age. The teacher had freely imparted this knowledge to her with no sense of worry. For how could he truly expect one such as her to ever in any lifetime, bear witness to the gateway. And yet here she stood.  Her eyes had strained into the dark, hoping for some shadow of movement to betray itself, hoping for some hint of the horrors within. Her blade had cut through countless foes, but none of them spectral, immaterial.

Her blade could not pierce the heart of a spirit, nor could she gaze into fading eyes of a spirit in its death knells.

She relished the sound of metal against bone.  Twisting blade into blood and sinew.  She always met the fading eyes of her enemy as the last gasps of their lives escaped, borne upon the wind back to whatever nameless hell they had been birthed.  Yes, she believed in her blade. Trusted her blade.  Her knowledge of the spirit realm was much less, adept.

Quiet minutes passed before she dared to step forward into blackness. No sooner had she made her first step past the when she cleared the entrance when her leg brushed a barely perceptible the stone doors closed with an abrupt BOOM that echoed with vile and uncanny resonance throughout the indeterminable length of the abyss.  She stifled a scream and dropped to one knee, silently cursing her lack of foresight and inability to detect even the most rudimentary mechanism.

From her vantage point, the crypt appeared vacant below. If this was to be the final resting place of Aabacus, the High Priest, then it

The voice grated through her mind like a thousand mice scrambling through the underdark.

“Lady Kappo! WE. SEE. YOU!”

[From the Accounts of Lady Kappo]

Lo! How the gods of the Trial Balance once again mock me!

To grant me this sliver of light and coax a plea from the remnants of my sanity.
I know that none but the End of Month Moon would be so brazen to illuminate
whatever catacomb abyss the Shadow Accountants have sought to conceal me within.
Would that I could once more set eyes upon the Great Plains above – the land of
my ancestors, home of my kin - whose voices have long since faded against the
maniacal howling of General Ledger as he urges his Czech Machine to rend through
soil and flesh. Not even these walls of black earth and cold stone can mute the
horror from assaulting my ears.

And yet here, caged, the last of my faith lies with you.

I implore you, Lady Célene Kappo,

born of the House of Gaap,

bearer of the Fair Countenance,

wielder of the Amórtize Blade,

slayer of the last Red Ink God,

hear my appeal for justice!

Whether by sword or flame or illusion or transmutation, I will not judge the
manner and design of your retribution!

For as we know,

the books demand balance.

[From the Accounts of Lady Kappo]

The last fortnight of each Fyscal Year is witness to an astronomical wonder as
yet unexplained by patrons of science or magic. The sun, whether directed by
forces cosmic or by the gods of the mystics, begins to trace a lazy arc across
the sky, never once falling below the horizon nor completely rising to its
zenith. Below, in the villages and estates of the south, there is cause for joy
as the last yield of crops are gathered and their sums weighed and measured
against years prior. While most revel in the promise of a bountiful harvest, the
more cunning look to a diminished return and lessened duty to the Cold Well Levy
- a fund long imposed to fill the coffers of the Kings and Queens of the White
Collar. And yet, despite such burden, these final days of Near Winter are a time
of celebration and mirth.

Not so in the vast expanse of the northern Great Plains, home to the frozen
Relevant Range.

Under the warmth of the suns constant vigil, the snow and ice begins to thaw
from the multitude of crags and peaks that form this black and desolate sierra,
slowly exposing the most sinister among them - the Salārie Spire. A narrow and
near impassable pathway also becomes visible, a serpentine pattern in its
ascent. Whether carved by nature or man, none can say with any certainty. Fewer
still make claim to having conquered the spire and among them none would dare
speak of what lies at the top.

But where the tales of adventurers end, the books of legend and lore show no
such fear. They speak of the final resting place of Aabacus, High Priest of the
Actuaries and Warden of the Petty Cache. Whispers of immeasurable treasures and
the monstrous creatures that guard them. And while the validity of its existence
has depreciated over the ages, the cracked and faded pages reveal a common truth
– that even the most iron forged of men – the most resolute of valor – the
sternest of constitution - all pale when confronted with the rumored horrors
within. And today, the books will speak true. No man will ever conquer the
summit. And indeed, a woman now stands before the doorway to the Necropolis of
the Bookkeeper.

Lady Célene Kappo has ascended the spire.

The massive stones guarding the ancient death chamber parted only after Lady
Kappo spoke the words she had been tasked to memorize at a much younger age. The
Magister had freely imparted this knowledge to her with no sense of worry. For
how could he truly expect one such as her to ever in any lifetime bear witness
to the gateway. And yet here she stood.  Her eyes had strained into the dark,
hoping for some shadow of movement to betray itself, hoping for some hint of the
horrors within. The Amórtize blade had cut through countless foes, but none of
them spectral, immaterial.  Could it pierce the heart of a spirit?

Lady Kappo relished the sound of metal against bone, deeply twisting blade into
blood and sinew as man and beast alike wretched in their death knells.  She
always met the fading eyes of her enemy as the last gasps of their lives
escaped, borne upon the wind back to whatever nameless hell they had been
birthed.  Yes, she believed in her blade. Trusted her blade.  Her knowledge of
the spirit realm was much less, adept.

Quiet minutes passed before she dared to set forth into blackness. No sooner had

against her forehead.  Her hand moved to her face just as the stone blocks began

the abyss.  She stifled a scream and dropped to her stomach, whispering curses

posts.html:
Last night I dreamt that the pandemic was over and I was running through the streets with joy, embracing even the most perfect strangers. Everyone was hugging and laughing and crying with unrestrained zeal. The voices of this relieved gathering resonated against the brick and mortar of my hometown in a swaying and blissful harmony.  I felt as though I were floating, and with eyes closed, I danced my way through the gathering crowd.

At last, the promise of a cure had been realized. Humankind, as one, had welcomed the chance to mend the collective errors of their ways and disavow any recurrence of past transgressions.  In this lucid creation of my deep slumber, I reveled in the unified joyfulness of the crowd and managed to smile with unrestrained glee even as my neighbors pressed themselves against me in a desperate attempt to be one with the growing promenade.

Not far from me I saw Isabella Rose, the woman I loved.  The pale beauty of her face was a radiant, golden glow against the muddled and muted colors of the surging crowd. Beneath the dark and flowing river of her hair, I spotted the emerald adorned locket that had been her wedding present. It cast a dazzling splash of color against the sun-kissed softness of her neck.  Using the sparkle of this gifted gem as a beacon, I began to maneuver my way to her side.

Suddenly, there was a commotion just at the edge of my periphery, and turning to face it, I saw an elderly woman disappear beneath the surging wave of revelers, her muffled screams nearly suppressed among the raucous cries of the joy-maddened crowd. I knew any effort to attempt a rescue would be in vain.  In a shocked daze, I watched as another, and another, and yet still another fell below the undercurrent of this crazed congregation.  Horrified, I spun toward my Isabella Rose and found her staring at me, eyes wild with confused intensity.

I motioned for her to make haste to the outermost edge of the crowd, toward the weathered stone of the nearby library archway.  Ever capable, I watched as she pressed and angled her way to the safety of that historic structure. Moments later, after circling the crowd, I found myself, at last, locked in the frantic and shivering clutches of my eternal companion.  In horror, we watched as more victims fell. But for every fallen, ten more crazed citizens took their place.

The singing was more of a chant now, a low undulating tremor pierced by the occasional horrified screams of the newly fallen.  As we stood in petrified embrace, the chant became an almost mournful plea. The crowd was begging for some type of solace - an angry desire to be forgiven. The streets rumbled in a deep resonance as the crowd struck the twisted chords of this forbidden beat and measure, undoubtedly having origins in some corrupted hymnal.

Through my gathering tears, I struggled to look upon the face of Isabella Rose, as she was quickly becoming a blurred silhouette of unrepentant beauty.  I savored the salted sweetness of her lips with a frantic kiss, more to calm my own fears than allay her own.  Then, pressing my face to hers, I whispered a quiet promise of my unending devotion.  She said nothing in return, save for tightening the grasp her arms had around me.

Without warning, the street in front of us erupted and became a hellish gash of asphalt and steel and blood and bone.  As the archway gave way around us, I closed my eyes and silently prayed that these ancient gods would grant me another lifetime with my beloved Isabella Rose, the only woman I would ever allow myself to love...

***I AWOKE VIOLENTLY TO THE SOUND OF MY OWN SCREAMING, HER AMULET PRESSING ANGRILY INTO MY TERROR CLUTCHED HAND.***

a.e

closed, I danced my way through the gathering crowd.

At last, the promise of a cure had been realized. Humankind, as one, had
welcomed the chance to mend the collective errors of their ways and disavow any
recurrence of past transgressions.  In this lucid creation of my deep slumber, I
reveled in the unified joyfulness of the crowd and managed to smile with
unrestrained glee even as my neighbors pressed themselves against me in a
desperate attempt to be one with the growing promenade.

Not far from me I saw Isabella Rose, the woman I loved.  The pale beauty of her
face was a radiant, golden glow against the muddled and muted colors of the
surging crowd. Beneath the dark and flowing river of her hair, I spotted the
emerald adorned locket that had been her wedding present. It cast a dazzling
splash of color against the sun-kissed softness of her neck.  Using the sparkle
of this gifted gem as a beacon, I began to maneuver my way to her side.

Suddenly, there was a commotion just at the edge of my periphery, and turning to
face it, I saw an elderly woman disappear beneath the surging wave of revelers,
her muffled screams nearly suppressed among the raucous cries of the
joy-maddened crowd. I knew any effort to attempt a rescue would be in vain.  In
a shocked daze, I watched as another, and another, and yet still another fell
below the undercurrent of this crazed congregation.  Horrified, I spun toward my
Isabella Rose and found her staring at me, eyes wild with confused intensity.

I motioned for her to make haste to the outermost edge of the crowd, toward the
weathered stone of the nearby library archway.  Ever capable, I watched as she
pressed and angled her way to the safety of that historic structure. Moments
later, after circling the crowd, I found myself, at last, locked in the frantic
and shivering clutches of my eternal companion.  In horror, we watched as more
victims fell. But for every fallen, ten more crazed citizens took their place.

The singing was more of a chant now, a low undulating tremor pierced by the
occasional horrified screams of the newly fallen.  As we stood in petrified
embrace, the chant became an almost mournful plea. The crowd was begging for

posts.html:
take courage
my young and fearful self
for i have been you.
i have endured the agony
of your awkward days
and lonely nights.
do not rush for tomorrow.
do not pray to bypass the events of the day
whether they are painful or pleasant.
experience each fully and completely.
i have lived your days.
tether your insecurities
to my future and growing confidence.
remember that even now, today
things are not perfect
nor should you expect them to be.
do not seek to be comfortable.
discover and delight in the wonders of yourself.
your creativity and heart
are gold among common stone.
i beg you to trust in me
for i am you
and i with you now
in awe of your future

a.e

posts.html:
Many years ago, one high school summer, I found myself lost in a Mexican neighborhood.  I ran into an elderly gentleman pushing a cart labeled LA MICHOACANA FRESCA, and he called me over with his broken and heavily accented Spanglish.  

"¿Quieres una Tweety?" he asked, pointing to the Looney Tunes popsicle advertisement displaying flavors of chocolate, strawberry dream, and lime.

"Si, por favor," I responded in my best attempt at a second language.
posts.plaintext:
Many years ago, one high school summer, I found myself lost in a Mexican
neighborhood.  I ran into an elderly gentleman pushing a cart labeled LA
MICHOACANA FRESCA, and he called me over with his broken and heavily accented
Spanglish.

"¿Quieres una Tweety?" he asked, pointing to the Looney Tunes popsicle
advertisement displaying flavors of chocolate, strawberry dream, and lime.

"Si, por favor," I responded in my best attempt at a second language.

posts.html:
my darkened realm is haunted

have you seen the face of this succubus?

demonic beauty

enchanting green eyes

eternal love that refuses to die

raven black hair dancing in the bitter wind

come be my precious

be my everything

decorated in sin

milky white skin blinding my sight

among the frozen stars

this night is yours again

posts.html:
The poop I just released.....by the gods...it was unholy. I'll never be forgiven for what I sent down that porcelain maw. It looked back and me....and....and...gods take me.....its brown eye seared into my wretched soul....
My plea for it to just pinch off and drop away fell upon deaf, brown ears. It's sharp, dry edges tore and ripped at my softly pink anal skin. I heard laughter from within as it finally drew blood....oh gods, the blood.....and endless soupy froth of shit and gore.
It took three flushes to rid my world of that brick and tan beast, and as the waters finally calmed, I flew into the deepest madness and despair.

My eyes! I must remove my eyes!  Not even the face of my beautiful Elanor could undo the horrors I was made bear to witness!  

I drove the dagger again and again into my dark sockets, shouting with unfettered glee!  HAHAHAHA!  Deeper and deeper I probed with the blade, scraping away every last bit of sinew, skin and bone.

My laughter had reached a fever mad pitch. So loud that I had unknowingly awoken my eternal bride, my purest Elanor.  Within an instant, her dire screams and my godless laughter filled the stone halls of our manor.  I felt her hands clutching at my face, her tears falling upon the twisted creases of my maddened grin.

"You bastard!" she cried.  "My sweet fool of a Prince! Why have you desecrated the face of my dearest knight!?  Woe - where once there were valiant eyes of brown, there is naught but an emptiness that is now my heart!"

I made no move to resist as she beat her soft, pale hands upon my chest until finally collapsing in soul-emptied exhaustion.  I ran my blood stained fingers through her hair and across her flushed cheeks, down to heartbeat pulse pressing rapidly just under her neck.  I could feel each beat of her heart as my hands began to grasp, ever tighter, just above the emerald and ruby necklace I had presented to her on our wedding day.

She began to struggle beneath the constricting firmness of my guilt laden hands.  I endeavored to be merciful and quick, in the final hope that she would be spared the horror of my face again.  With a quiet twist, Elanor was no more.
I held her for what must have been days. She had long become rigid and cold in my grasp, but I could not let her go.  I was determined to end my days here, with my silent Elanor, in a cage of my eternal grief.

My chamber doors wretched open suddenly and without restraint.  "No!" I screamed.  "Not again! Gods grant me this last favor!"  

I could feel the dark cold shape as it stalked me.  I rose to my feet and stumbled away from my dead lover.  With fumbling effort, I drew my moon soaked sword to face the inevitable - the moonlight infused glow piercing even the empty gore of my eyes.

"Damn you!  Come then, and taste the cold steel of my blade!"  I screamed.

A cold chill rushed over me and I swung wildly in blind rage.  The shape was unrelenting in its power and its form crashed against my blade in waves of unbridled rage.

'Never again! I will not release you!' I cried.

The drumming against my insides reached a peak and finally my fortitude began to fray. My barren sockets rushed with bloody, mocking tears and I felt the rending of my flesh anew.

I reached down and cupped my pink hole with my hand in a hopeless effort to contain this fetid demon.

I barely registered any pain as the excrement lunged forward snared my fingers within its teeth. I screamed a final plea of forgiveness to my lost Elanor as the shadow began to envelop me...

"Elanor, take me..."

My plea for it to just pinch off and drop away fell upon deaf, brown ears. It's sharp, dry edges tore and ripped at my softly pink anal skin. I heard laughter from within as it finally drew blood....oh gods, the blood.....and endless soupy froth of shit and gore.

My laughter had reached a fever mad pitch. I made no move to resist as she beat her soft, pale hands upon my chest until finally collapsing in soul-emptied exhaustion.  I ran my blood stained fingers through her hair and across her flushed cheeks, down to heartbeat pulse pressing rapidly just under her neck.  I could feel each beat of her heart as my hands began to grasp, ever tighter, just above the emerald and ruby necklace I had presented to her on our wedding day.

posts.html:
Livia, my dearest.  They call me foolhardy, but you are more reckless than even the bond of our vows should allow.  Your pursuit of arcane knowledge is admirable, but this time I fear you have gone too far.

I knew you were following a rumor through the wastelands, the scent of dark rituals allowing access to the elder worlds.  But since your last letter, begging to me come here, I have heard nothing.  It's not like you, on the edge of discovery, to become so abruptly silent.

So I promised to find you and now I am here, at the outskirts of a desolate township, under dark eldritch skies.  What did you discover Livia?  Are you still here?  And if not, have you left a trail for me to follow?
posts.plaintext:
Livia, my dearest.  They call me foolhardy, but you are more reckless than even the bond of our vows should allow.  Your pursuit of arcane knowledge is admirable, but this time I fear you have gone too far.

I knew you were following a rumor through the wastelands, the scent of dark rituals allowing access to the elder worlds.  But since your last letter, begging to me come here, I have heard nothing.  It's not like you, on the edge of discovery, to become so abruptly silent.

So I promised to find you and now I am here, at the outskirts of a desolate township, under dark eldritch skies.  What did you discover Livia?  Are you still here?  And if not, have you left a trail for me to follow?

posts.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The fact that I do not talk to my gym crush is certainly NOT a sign of some greater commitment-phobic-linked relationship issue. The appeal of my crush is the mysterious, fantastical, fitness and motivational dopamine hit she delivers from across the room. Does she lift more than me? Yes. Does she lift WAY more than me? YES. Talking to her would simply ruin everything. I enjoy fictionalizing the 23 hours of the day that I don’t spend with her – imagining just WHERE THE HELL SHE’S BEEN and just WHO THE HELL SHE'S BEEN SPENDING TIME WITH."],[1,[],0,0],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"Perfectly normal, super-cute, crush stuff."]]]],"ghostVersion":"4.0"}
posts.html:
The fact that I do not talk to my gym crush is certainly NOT a sign of some greater commitment-phobic-linked relationship issue. The appeal of my crush is the mysterious, fantastical, fitness and motivational dopamine hit she delivers from across the room. Does she lift more than me? Yes. Does she lift WAY more than me? YES. Talking to her would simply ruin everything. I enjoy fictionalizing the 23 hours of the day that I don’t spend with her – imagining just WHERE THE HELL SHE’S BEEN and just WHO THE HELL SHE'S BEEN SPENDING TIME WITH.

Perfectly normal, super-cute, crush stuff.
